titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: I spent the day in bed very uselessly. Godfrey spent most of the afternoon with me, & so the time passed.
There was no correspondence of interest, & noting in the papers worth noting.

p.hi: There seems reason for thinking that this insane strike of miners in Yorkshire is nearing an end with the invariable consequences â€“ heavy loss to the country, & another victory to the disloyal agitators
The strike is notable as introducing into our Labour conflicts the sinister factor known as
, i.e. the wilful wrecking of the machinery, so that the industry itself is in danger of being destroyed, & the very means of their livelihood imperilled by the strikers.
